alert.note: Alert for Northern Lake County; Okeechobee; Orange; Osceola; Seminole; Southern Lake County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 2:36AM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Locally Dense Fog Spreading East Into the Interior Counties of East Central Florida... At 230 AM, surface observations, satellite imagery and traffic cameras showed an area of fog spreading east across southern Lake County, and about to reach the Kissimmee River from the Four Corners area south to near Basinger in Okeechobee County. Through sunrise, the fog is expected to continue to spread east across the interior counties. and linger through 900 or 1000 AM. Visibilities will drop below 1 mile in many areas and as a low as 400 yards in some locations. Should the fog become more dense and widespread, then a Dense Fog Advisory would be issued. If you will be out driving on area roadways early this morning, prepare to encounter rapid reductions in visibility due to dense fog. When driving in fog, slow down, use your low beam headlights, and leave plenty of driving distance between your car and the one in front of you.

area.areaDesc: Northern Lake County; Okeechobee; Orange; Osceola; Seminole; Southern Lake County
